methods.Synopsis: Make gene query and return matching gene list. Support JSONP and CORS as well.

parameters.Name: q
parameters.Description: query string. The detailed query syntax can be found at http://mygene.info/doc/query_service

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: the fields of returned gene objects (default is "symbol,name,taxid,entrezgene,ensemblgene". The supported field names can be found at http://dev.mygene.info/metadata

parameters.Name: species
parameters.Description: filter the returned gene objects for given species, support taxonomy ids for now, e.g. species=9606, species=9606,10090,10116 (default)

parameters.Name: size
parameters.Description: the maximum number of results to return (with a cap of 1000 at the moment)

parameters.Name: from
parameters.Description: the number of results to return from. Combining with "size" parameter, this can be useful for paging

parameters.Name: sort
parameters.Description: the comma-separated fields to sort on. Prefix with "-" for descending order (default as ascending)

parameters.Name: callback
parameters.Description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.

parameters.Name: q
parameters.Description: multiple query terms seperated by comma (also support "+" or white space), but no wildchar, e.g., "q=1017,1018" or "q=CDK2+BTK"

parameters.Name: scopes
parameters.Description: specify one or more fields (separated by comma) as the search "scope", e.g., "scopes=entrezgene", "scopes=entrezgene,ensemblgene"

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: the fields of returned gene objects (default is "symbol,name,taxid,entrezgene,ensemblgene". The supported field names can be found at http://dev.mygene.info/metadata

parameters.Name: species
parameters.Description: filter the returned gene objects for given species, support taxonomy ids for now, e.g. species=9606, species=9606,10090,10116 (default)

methods.MethodName: Gene query service by genome interval
methods.Synopsis: Make gene query by genome interval and return genes within that region. Support JSONP and CORS as well.

parameters.Name: q
parameters.Description: genome interval in format of "chr#:start-end", e.g., chrX:151,073,054-151,383,976 (comma allowed)

parameters.Name: species
parameters.Description: specify the species by taxonomy id, e.g., 9606,10090,10116.

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: the fields of returned gene objects (default is "symbol,name,taxid,entrezgene,ensemblgene". The supported field names can be found at http://dev.mygene.info/metadata

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve gene annotation based on Entrez or Ensembl gene id, support JSONP and CORS as well.

parameters.Name: geneid
parameters.Description: Entrez or Ensembl gene id, e,g., 1017, ENSG00000170248. A retired Entrez Gene id works too if it is replaced by a new one, e.g., 245794

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: return only the specified object attributes (support dot notation for "sub-attributes"), multiple attributes can be seperated by a comma, e.g., "filter=name,symbol", "filter=name,symbol,refseq.rna"

parameters.Name: callback
parameters.Description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.

methods.Synopsis: Make gene queries in batch for a list of Entrez or Ensembl gene ids

parameters.Name: ids
parameters.Description: multiple geneids seperated by comma, e.g., "ids=1017,1018" or "ids=695,ENSG00000123374". Note that currently we only take the input ids up to 1000 maximum, the rest will be omitted.

parameters.Name: scopes
parameters.Description: specify one or more fields (separated by comma) as the search "scope", e.g., "scopes=entrezgene", "scopes=entrezgene,ensemblgene"

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: return only the specified object attributes, e.g., "fields=name,symbol", "filter=name,symbol,refseq.rna" (same as the GET request above)

parameters.Name: species
parameters.Description: filter the returned gene objects for given species, support taxonomy ids for now, e.g. species=9606, species=9606,10090,10116 (default)
